utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: I’m ready!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You sure?

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: Uh-huh!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, let me just straighten out your helmet there.

utterance.speaker: Ben
utterance.content: Thanks daddy.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No-no, one daddy, two mommies. All right, it’s all yours.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay. Okay.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yes! Yes! Yes!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: His first big kid’s bike, this is so exciting!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh yeah, I remember mine! Ohh, it was my sixth birthday, my dad took me to the park, I got it, and…it bent.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I never had a bike of my own.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, we didn’t have a lot of money. But the girl across the street had the best bike! It was pink and it had rainbow colored tassels hanging off the handle grips, and-and-and a bell and this big, white wicker basket with those plastic daisies stuck on.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That sounds like my first bike. My dad gave me his old one.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ohh.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Did the girl ever let you ride it?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No! But she gave me the box that it came in. It had a picture of the bike on the front. So I would sit on it and my step-dad would drag me around the backyard.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That is so unfair!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Not really, I got to drag him around too!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey! What are you guys doing?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Making holiday candy for the neighbors.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’m sorry, who?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I’m gonna hang this basket on the door and when the neighbors walk by they can all take a piece.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: But we don’t know the neighbors.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I do. There’s uh, let’s see, Guy With a Mustache, Smokes-A-Lot Lady, Some Kids I’ve Seen, and A Red-haired Guy Who Does Not Like To Be Called Rusty.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: See? This is exactly why I’m making this candy. We can learn their names and get to know our neighbors.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Wouldn’t it be easier if we just moved?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Gooood morning!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Eh, somebody’s in a good mood!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, why shouldn’t I be? I have great friends! I have a wonderful job!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Where you can make out with your assistant.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Come on, it’s not a big deal! We stayed up all night coming up with a plan so that us dating will not be a problem.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh yeah, what’s the plan?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: We… We are not… …going to let it… be a problem.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wow! It took you all night to come up with that plan?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well y’know, we did other stuff too.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Did you two…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh Monica come on, y’know I don’t sleep with guys on the first date!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Matt Guire, Mark Lynn, Ben Wire…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Anymore!!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi. Tag, I have a conference call today is that correct?

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: Yes, at 4:00.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, thank you. That’ll be all. Wait! Wait! Did you see that? That mail guy had no idea there was something going on between us.

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: I’d better get back to my desk.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, you hard worker! I’ll remember to put that in your evaluation.

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: My what?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, you’ve been here for two months now and your boss is required to hand in a performance evaluation. But y’know, there is one thing that I have yet to evaluate.

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: Are you serious?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, I’ve just always wanted to do that. Can you help me clean this up?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: The basket is totally empty! My God, the neighbors ate all the candy!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, either that or uh…

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Joey!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Did you eat all the neighbor candy?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Uh well yeah, that was the plan, but by the time I got to it there was only a couple of pieces left!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, and they’ve been coming by all day. They love it!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: They love my candy? Oh man!!! I’ve gotta go make more!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey Mon, you might wanna make some more lasagna too, because something might’ve happened to a huge chunk of it.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ross! The neighbors ate all my candy!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Mine stole my newspaper! It’s like a crime wave!! Pheebs, you uh, you got a second.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Sure!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, ever since you uh, told me that story about that bike I-I couldn’t stop thinking about it. I mean, everyone should have a-a first bike, so…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh my God Ross!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You like it?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I love it!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ohh!! Ohh!! And I love you!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ahh.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Not that way! But the bike brought you a lot closer!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ah! Well uh-uh, t-take it downstairs, y’know give it a test ride.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay! Oh my God! My first bike! Thank you for the best present I’ve ever gotten.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You’re welcome.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh and Chandler’s about to cry.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Am not!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Who is that?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Don’t worry, I’m brave! I am brave! I…I am brave! No-no-no-no!! Can you tell me who is there please?

utterance.speaker: The Knocker
utterance.content: My name is Gary, I live upstairs.

utterance.speaker: Gary
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hi. Do you know what time it is?

utterance.speaker: Gary
utterance.content: It’s candy time! My roommate says that they taste like little drops of heaven.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh please! Did you hear that? Little drops of heaven.

utterance.speaker: Gary
utterance.content: So, can I get some candy?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I am sorry, but some of us have to get up early and go to work! He does not know that I am not some of us.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Umm, listen I am sorry, but I’ll put some out first thing in the morning.

utterance.speaker: Gary
utterance.content: Well okay, I’ll swing by later. Do you live in this building?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Um-hmm.

utterance.speaker: Gary
utterance.content: Mm! Seems like I would’ve remembered you!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Mm! Night Gar’!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So did you read your evaluation yet?

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: No! It was marked confidential I just sent it down to Human Resources.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay please, you’re kidding right?! I wrote that one as a joke for you!

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: A joke they would appreciate?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I’m thinkin’ no.

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: What did you say?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Umm, I said I thought you were a good kisser, and uh, and that I like your tiney-tiny touchie.

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: No, not my touchie.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, it gets worse. When asked if you take initiative I wrote, "Yes, he was able to unhook my bra with minimal supervision," and under Problems with Performance I wrote, "Dear God, I hope not," and then uh, then I drew a little smiley face, and then a small pornographic sketch.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ross! That is so sweet of you to get Phoebe that bike! When I heard the story, I almost cried.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Almost cried huh? Hear that Chandler? Almost cried!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, you cry every time somebody talks about Titanic!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Those two only had each other!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Phoebe really likes the bike huh?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh yeah! I saw her walkin’ it down the street the other day. She had uh, these flowers in the basket. It was so cute.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, I saw her this morning walkin’ it by the park.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Wait a minute, she was walking the bike? Both times?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey Pheebs?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh hi!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey! So are you enjoying the bike?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ohh, uh-huh so much!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Pheebs you uh…you do know how to ride a bike don’t you?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Of course!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Umm, can we see you ride it?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay. See?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: See, this is why I told you never get involved with your assistant! And here is no such thing as keeping secrets when it comes to affairs. Did you hear that Chandler? No such thing!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What happened? I’m just eating candy.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Maybe it’s not as bad as I think. Y’know, maybe they didn’t take it the way I meant it.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Absolutely! Y’know, because touchie can mean both ass and good worker.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ugh, I just gotta get the thing back!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey Rach?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That sketch you mentioned? Might it have looked a little something like this?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my God! Joey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What is the matter with you?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ugh!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Boy I tell ya, this little talent came in handy before I could afford porn.

utterance.speaker: The Woman
utterance.content: Hi! I’m sorry, I know it’s after hours but I really need candy.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I’m sorry, I can’t help you. See? Rules are rules.

utterance.speaker: The Woman
utterance.content: Please! I have people coming from out of town today! And, I told them all about your candy!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No kidding, out of towners huh? What did you tell ‘em?

utterance.speaker: The Woman
utterance.content: I told ‘em your candy is absolutely indescribable!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Some people have been saying its y’know little drops of heaven, but whatever.

utterance.speaker: The Woman
utterance.content: Please, can’t you help me out?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey Chandler, do we know that lady?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Maybe, isn’t she the woman who lives below you and has sex really loud?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: All right, I’ll do it just this once! But you can’t tell anybody!

utterance.speaker: The Woman
utterance.content: Yes! Yes! Please, just give it to me!

utterance.speaker: Joey and Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s her.

utterance.speaker: The Woman
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It’s unbelievable! I-I can’t believe that sign didn’t work!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Y’know what would work?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hmm?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Stop making candy!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: But they like it!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You mean they like you.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Maybe.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Is that why you became a chef? So that people would like you?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, you really want to talk about getting people to like you huh, funny man?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, now just remember everything I taught you and you’ll be fine. Okay? Here we go. Ready…Set…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wait! This seat is really uncomfortable! Yeah, maybe before we start we should just get another one. Perhaps, like an airplane seat—or a beanbag chair!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Phoebe, you can’t get out of this! Okay? You have to learn how to ride a bike!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Why? Why do I have to learn?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well…In-in case of emergency.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What kind of an emergency?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well let there—what if a man comes along and puts a gun to your head and says, "You ride this bike or I’ll sh…I’ll shoot you."

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, I would ring the bell to distract him and then I would knock the gun out of his hand with a Chinese throwing star.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, Phoebe just-just get-get on the bike and—Hey! I’ll hold you up and-and push you. Okay?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You won’t let go?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Swear?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I swear!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Come on. All right, here we go. All right?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: All right. Feel good?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well…

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: All right, try pedaling.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That’s it, your doing great.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Doing great! Yes-yes-yes! Take control! Yes!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Weee!!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yes!! Yes!!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh! Oh! Oh no!! You swore!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I-I just thought you were doing so well. I…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I am shocked! Shocked!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It’s a legitimate learning technique. Wow!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, there’s uh, some people outside, askin’ about candy.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, they’re just gonna have to wait aren’t they? I’ve only got two hands!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Need some help?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No! You don’t know the system! There’ll be nobody messing with the system!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: By the way, the week before your wedding you may not see a lot of me.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, hello liar.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Look, I-I’m really sorry I let go of the bike.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I could’ve been killed I hope you know!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I know. I know. But, can we please try it again? Huh? I mean, you were so close Phoebe!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, I would love to but…the bike got stolen and the police have no suspects.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Phoebe.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What?! What the hell?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: All right, y’know what? If you are not going to learn how to ride this bike then I’m sorry, I’m just gonna have to take it back.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What?! Why?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Because! Because, it-it-it’s… It’d be like you having this guitar and-and never playing it. Okay, this guitar wants to be played! And-and this bike wants to be ridden and-and if you don’t ride it you-you’re-you’re killing its spirit! The bike is dying.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: All right. If you care enough to make up that load of crap, okay.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Great! Great! You’re making the bike very happy.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay Ross! Please don’t die!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, I think we can get the evaluation back before they see it, but we’re gonna have to get into Mr. Zelner’s office. Now, he doesn’t get in until 10, so he’s no problem, but his assistant, Betty, she comes in early to eat her breakfast at her desk.

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: That’s kinda sad.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, well Betty’s kinda sad. Which is why I believe I can lure her away with these chocolates. Now, while I distract her, you get in the office.

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: Got it!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Let’s roll!

utterance.speaker: Mr. Zelner
utterance.content: Hello Rachel, you uh, got a minute?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, sure Mr. Zelner, for you anything—minute. Okay. Fine. Abort the plan, abort the plan.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Zelner
utterance.content: Uh actually, I’d like to speak with both of you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay. Uh, well can we, can we get you anything Mr. Zelner? Maybe some chocolates?

utterance.speaker: Mr. Zelner
utterance.content: Umm, no. Thanks, but I’ll give these to Betty. So I read your evaluation of Tag, or to use his full name, Tag Sweetcheeks Jones. Is something going on with you two?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my God. Can you imagine if there was?! I mean, what would happen exactly.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Zelner
utterance.content: Well, I’d be forced to file a report. I’d have to consult with the legal department, and your future at the company would be in jeopardy.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well…

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: Uh Mr. Zelner, I’m the one who filled in that evaluation.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh no-no-no…

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: Yeah-yeah-yeah-yeah-yeah, I thought it would be funny.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Zelner
utterance.content: You wrote that you have a cute touchie?

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: Yes. I have a weird sense of humor, and I’m kinda strangely proud of my butt.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Zelner
utterance.content: It’s kind of a risky joke Tag, and what is-what is this drawing I can’t figure out what this is?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You’re lookin’ at it upside down—y’know what? It doesn’t matter.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Zelner
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s not like I don’t have a sense of humor, huh? Hell, I even enjoy a naughty limerick now and then. But there’s a time and a place, huh?! Unless you uh, have a limerick right now? No? Okay, well uh, you’ve got my fax number.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Whoa! I can’t believe you did that. That was really sweet.

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: No, don’t worry about it.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, you could’ve lost your job.

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: Are you kidding me?! With a cute butt like this, I’d find work.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Thank you! You’re great!

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: Y’know what?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: I feel great. In fact! What?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I… It just—it took me so long to get that desk organized.

utterance.speaker: Tag
utterance.content: Oh, I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: There it is.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What is going on?

utterance.speaker: The Man
utterance.content: We’re waiting for the candy. Bring out the candy!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah lady! Give us candy!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Joey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What’s up buddy?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Waiting for candy.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Get in here! Hey, and you can not smoke in here! Merry Christmas.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, guys! The candy is coming; I just need another 15 minutes for the chocolate to cool!

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: We want candy! We want candy now!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right everybody! Just be quiet! Be quiet! Be quiet!! Pipe-pipe-pipe down! What is the matter with you people?! This woman was trying to do a nice thing for you. She was making candy so she could try to get to know all of you, and I’ll bet that not one of you can tell me her name! Am I right?

utterance.speaker: The Man
utterance.content: Candy Lady?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No not Candy Lady.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, if we know it can we have candy?!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right, y’know what? Forget it, all of you forget it! You’ve ruined it! Go home! You’ve ruined it! You’ve ruined it!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That’s right, it’s all ruined! You guys ruined everything! You ruined it!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You’re welcome.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Did you smoke?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No! Smokes-A-Lot Lady blew smoke directly into my mouth. Eh-uh—are you okay?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I’m fine now, but it was really scary there for a while. I mean, someone slipped a-a threatening note under the door.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh yeah, sorry about that. Mob mentality or whatever, I don’t know…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I can’t believe it! I did it! I rode a bike! I never thought I’d be able to do that! Thank you Ross.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh hey, don’t thank me, thank yourself. You’re the one who faced her fears and ultimately overcame them.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Don’t be so corny Ross, it’s not an after-school special.
